byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from London, and Alison Smale from Vienna.
byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and ALISON SMALE

abstract: Right and far-right politicians emerge as some of biggest beneficiaries of migrant crisis in Europe; right-wing nationalist parties have been growing due to opposition to immigration, Islam and European Union, and are vocally criticizing efforts by some countries to accommodate more refugees.
lead_paragraph: Parties in opposition to immigration, Islam’s influence and the European Union are pointing out the difficulty of now shutting the migrant tap.

headline.main: Migrant Influx May Give Europe’s Far Right a Lift
headline.print_headline: Migrant Influx May Give Europe’s Far Right a Lift

snippet: Parties in opposition to immigration, Islam’s influence and the European Union are pointing out the difficulty of now shutting the migrant tap.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
